subject: p16826047
Findings: PA and lateral radiographs of the chest demonstrate that the right pleural effusion, which had been drained on the radiograph, has returned to the size it was on. In addition, there is right middle and lower lobe collapse. There is no shift of mediastinal structures. The visible lung fields are clear. There is no pneumothorax or left-sided effusion. Moderate cardiomegaly is unchanged. Pulmonary vascularity is normal. There is a right-sided chest wall port with the catheter terminating in the low SVC.
Impression: Reaccumulation of moderate right pleural effusion.
